title: Should I buy a 4G phone in India now (I prefer using a phone for a minimum of 3 years) or wait for a 5G device to come up under 20 thousand rupees price segment in 2020? - Quora

response.answer_text: Everyone needs a working phone these days. If you already have a working 4G phone, don’t buy any new phone. If your existing phone is having some issue / outdated, I suggest that you buy one of the phones listed in Best cheap phones 2020: top budget mobiles in India immediately. No network in India supports 5G for now. It will take at least 9 months for commercial 5G lauch in India. It might take around 2 years at least for multiple telecom companies to support 5G. New 4G phones purchased now have 1 year warranty and will start becoming outdated only after 2 years. You can plan to update from 4G to 5G after 2.5 years with cheaper 5G phones

Depending upon your usage, brand, preference, specs, requirements, budget I'd suggest you go for a 4G VoLte smartphone as off now. By the time the phone's battery reaches it's end of useful life in 3–4 years 5G Technology networks & Handsets 'd 've arrived matured in India & 5G phones 'd 'be available for ₹ 10–15K by 2024. Plus 4G 'll exist in 2024 also, 'd be much cheaper then, like Today's 2G of 1994. Swami Aniruddha
